body: Hi guys, Firstly, thanks for the help. Unfortunately, the situation does not change updating the Honybee components. The first image shows the output view of the 10 west oriented zones before the solve adjacencies. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/0JM2umRWL9eK7hLygnf*ofjDYsBx6WV5FePDvi*fn2whB*ASg*odWBMMGoRniDV5pUi9QHB6CuX9b5zXi7frgbYA6owtm-Fs/Cattura.PNG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/0JM2umRWL9f2sqFDmjcpNvb2v6eknNQR*-RrXkxQucdGD5FDgp41meb8mILY93JlcLfSDO6pmDiycbQVwh9morjJ1IloBnk8/Cattura2.PNG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/0JM2umRWL9f2sqFDmjcpNvb2v6eknNQR*-RrXkxQucdGD5FDgp41meb8mILY93JlcLfSDO6pmDiycbQVwh9morjJ1IloBnk8/Cattura2.PNG) Then, this is what I got after the solve adjacencies, in which I have connected 10 west oriented zones and 10 stairwell zones. The 10 Zones are one on the other. In fact, running the E+ simulation, I obtain the same energy consumption for each of the 10 west oriented zones.[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/0JM2umRWL9f2sqFDmjcpNvb2v6eknNQR*-RrXkxQucdGD5FDgp41meb8mILY93JlcLfSDO6pmDiycbQVwh9morjJ1IloBnk8/Cattura2.PNG) Did you get the same error? Giuseppe
